Introduction to ryx

Source: vignettes/ryx.Rmd
ryx.Rmd
library(ryx)

Let’s go over how to use the functions in ryx

Let’s first show how to use ryx() 

library(MASS)
object <- ryx(Boston, y="medv")

Now let’s get a summary of the correlations between medv and all the other variables 

summary(object)
#> Correlating medv with crim zn indus nox rm age dis tax ptratio black lstat 
#> The median absolute correlation was 0.427 with a range from 0.25 to 0.738 
#> 11 out of 11 variables were significant at the p < 0.05 level.

Now let’s print out all of the correlations between medv and all the other variables 

print(object)
#> Correlations of medv with variables: crim, zn, indus, nox, rm, age, dis, tax, ptratio, black, lstat 
#>       variable          r            p sigif
#> cor10    lstat -0.7376627 5.081103e-88   ***
#> cor4        rm  0.6953599 2.487229e-74   ***
#> cor8   ptratio -0.5077867 1.609509e-34   ***
#> cor2     indus -0.4837252 4.900260e-31   ***
#> cor7       tax -0.4685359 5.637734e-29   ***
#> cor3       nox -0.4273208 7.065042e-24   ***
#> cor       crim -0.3883046 1.173987e-19   ***
#> cor5       age -0.3769546 1.569982e-18   ***
#> cor1        zn  0.3604453 5.713584e-17   ***
#> cor9     black  0.3334608 1.318113e-14   ***
#> cor6       dis  0.2499287 1.206612e-08   ***

Now let’s plot all of the correlations between medv and all the other variables 

plot(object)
